website_summaries.verdict: A basic, affordable dip station with a surprisingly stable build for the price. It may not be practical for tall individuals who prefer more space.
pros: Padded grips and safety connector help make workouts more effective and supportive
Sturdy yet lightweight and easy to move
cons: Taller consumers, especially those over 6', may find it too close to the floor during some types of exercises

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with these bars
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with these bars. It's really nice to have a connecting pipe to improve stability. The connection even allows for different widths. I mainly use it without the connector, but it's nice to have. Good quality @ a very nice price. If you aren't stuck on having a popular name in the market you can save a lot of money with this set. It's just the tool, & if you can't do 20 dips with these, you won't be able to them on the ones costing $100 either.
customer_reviews.author: Kenton

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed and built in 5min. Definitely worth buying for the price and quality you are getting. The sunny side decal logo is already coming off. But that no problem at all. It came with all bolts and washers and a disposable tool. Will be enjoying this all summer long very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Recinos

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6' and use these for dips and they work more than fine. I have no issues w the height from the floor. I don't use the connector bar (seems pointless) as they stay solid on the wood floors in my apt the price had me skeptical as it's half the price of other brands but it's just a deal!! Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality I’ve used it for a couple workouts already thanks to their fast shipping and easy assembly in literally 7 mins ... I’m 5’6” and the height for dips are perfect for me and help with my learning calisthenics
customer_reviews.author: julian sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to assemble. It is packaged very well so it took me longer to get it out of the package than it did to assemble it. Im so glad I bought his model instead of pay two-three times as much for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: 111k

customer_reviews.title: These are just as good of quality as the ones they sell but for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have seen these all over facebook and pinterest and looked into buying them from bodyrock but they were over $150. When I found these on Amazon I bought them to try them out. I can do the exact same bodyrock work out with these. These are just as good of quality as the ones they sell but for way cheaper. Love getting a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Maegan Cranston

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular set because of the safety connector, but the adjustment knobs are not working properly. The bars are still usable with the safety connector in place, but only one of the adjustment knobs will "click" in to place and lock. It's like the holes aren't lined up so the other side won't click in to a hole on the other side to lock. I still use them, but it would be nice if both sides would lock in to place. But for half the price of other dip stations (which don't offer a safety connector), I am happy with the overall sturdiness of the product. It was also very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, incredibly sturdy. No need to spend the extra for a name!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product, and I highly recommend it. The bars are incredibly stable and I can't express that enough. I'm 5'4, 135 lbs and have no problem with dips, inverted pull ups etc... My husband is 6'2 and 210 lbs and he had absolutely zero issues with dips. There is no bowing in the bars, no shaking, and the grips aren't rough on the hands. Incredibly solid, sturdy and quality. The package came with needed all parts and the tool and arrived promptly. With this product, there is absolutely no reason to spend a ton of money for a name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but short
customer_reviews.text: I think I will have fun with this dip bar, but it is far too short for me. I am 5'11" and I have to bend my knees for my hands to reach down for the hand pads. I wish it was at least six inches taller. A previous reviewer suggested that somebody 5'7" or taller should get a different dip bar and I agree with them. It was easy to assemble and seems sturdy. I expect to get my money's worth of entertainment from it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Keep low expectations
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have expectations this is great for the price. Mone however came damaged UNDER where it was packaged and wrapped tightly. Clearly this damage happened before shipping. Though it was easy to assemble, it also had sharp edges that wrapped a hole in my yoga pants... too much of a hassle to ship back. I'm under 200 lbs. and I dont feel this is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy for its Price
customer_reviews.text: The wrong item was initially shipped. Was quickly replaced with the correct one by Amazon. Item is surprisingly strong and stable for its price. Major drawback if you are over 6’ is the product height. I am unable to get a full extension when lowering into position. If you are under 6’ this is a great buy. Over? I would look for one that is a few inches taller.
customer_reviews.author: DJC

customer_reviews.title: Holes are off
customer_reviews.text: They seem pretty solid, but one of the T joints has the holes cut wrong. I can't insert the bolts If I get the outside hole to line up, the 2 side holes are off. There is no way to get sides to line up, they don't fit
customer_reviews.author: n.anderson

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, for the price, you can't go wrong with these. They're surprisingly stable, even without the stabilizer bar attached. I would have full confidence doing more advance moves on these. As long as you're not wildly flinging you body around, you should have no issues. With the stabilizer bar connected, you definitely won't have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Rochniak

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed with this purchase and really haven’t been able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to save money to add one of these to my home gym but should have just bought the Leibert brand originally. These are not very durable, the parts did not fit as securely as I was hoping, they wobble and aren’t even. I am disappointed with this purchase and really haven’t been able to use it for the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Klynns2480

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The opening was bent, wouldn’t fit in the leg opening. I had to take a blow torch to it and bend it back into shape...a blow torch. Overall easy to put together and the quality seems to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: what a waste of my time and
customer_reviews.text: I would give zero stars if I could.....do not buy!! The holes are not aligned correctly and the tool they give you to tighten the bolts won’t grip them at all.......what a waste of my time and money
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money for Something Better
customer_reviews.text: I just got this product today and tried putting it together, the holes are misaligned so I could only get one screw in each leg when I should be able to get 3 screws in for stability. I rushed to get this because I enjoy calisthenics more than lifting weights and it was ready to ship versus a long weight for better equipment like Lebert but I wished I had saved my money or just waited for the better equipment. The exercises I do on this will be limited because I do not trust the stability, the extra connecting bar in the front makes it usable so I will try and get my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: John I. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly - strong
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, included flat wrench not very useful. All the bolts could be screwed in finger tight and then used a real 14mm 6" box\open wrench to tighten all the bolts. I'm 235 lbs, 6'2" started with 10 pullups and pair of partual dipps. Strong and stable! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: These are priced fairly and work exactly as intended. ...
customer_reviews.text: These are priced fairly and work exactly as intended. They lose 1 star because while assembling the tool was designed for many different sized bolts when only 1 was needed which wasn't a problem but the placement for the size bolt i needed was in a very inconvenient spot which made things take longer. Other than that no issues 2-3 weeks into using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: A. Harada

customer_reviews.title: Great for main reason I ordered but disappointed was not high for the leiketcal stepper
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like that height cannot be adjusted. Not high enough to use with auto stepper to hold on to for safety . But great for leg exercises and to use with regular stepper for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent dip bar for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Decent dip bar set up for beginners of callisthenics/bodyweight training. Quality wise, the logo on the padded portion of the bar may wear away over time, but that is a minor cosmetic issue. As another reviewer mentioned previously, a metric wrench set helps tremendously with assembly because you can tighten the bolts enough for the dip bar to be sturdy; don't bother using the included manual wrench, you will save yourself a lot of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: WAS HESITANT TO WRITE A BAD REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about choosing this product. It looked to be the best and safest. It got here quickly. The packaging is great and has a really good safety reminder. HOWEVER the gooves/ridges in one of my dip bars do not make proper contact with the screw. So it's rickety. I thought I could just get over it, but I don't want to hurt my shoulders. SO. THIS SUCKS!
customer_reviews.author: Allen Makere

customer_reviews.title: Works really well for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to assemble, just precaution to read the weight capacity and ensure no one who surpasses uses it or else it’ll start bending. But again it’s in the description and in their booklet
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Ahuatzi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: These are super sturdy. Exactly as pictured and pretty easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, adjustable and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, adjustable and easy to put together. I feel safe when doing dips on these and the hand grips are great. If you are tall it may be too low for you to do tricep dips, i'm 5'11 and they work great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set for the price. I was going to. Make my own at Home Depot, but it was going to cost about the same as ordering this. Some of the words were already worn off the handles I think they were just worn not that it was used. I'm a 5'5 lady and assembled by myself in about 15 minutes. It definitely enhanced my home gym and work outs. I use the HIIT workouts as well as some workouts I found on Pinterest
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 3 years now and it still holds up great! I’m 5’5 and use this frequently for weighted dips and I can’t complain. It does the job perfectly. The only problem I see with this product is if you’re really tall and might have to bend your legs more than I have to
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but a bit difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It took me around 30 min to an hour to assemble, while it should have been a 10 minute job. The tool provided was horrible, and I used my own to assemble this. However, after assembly the dip bars work amazing and are stable for dips and leg raises and some other exercises. I just wish it was height adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: jaden wei

customer_reviews.title: The Best Buy.
customer_reviews.text: The best bang for buck. I looked at them all. I now have these. Very stable with or without the stabilizer. Just bend you legs as you dip. 5' 9" 195. Works for me. Dips are the most effective upper body exercise for me.
customer_reviews.author: joe lanza

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy craftsmanship but useable
customer_reviews.text: Useful product with good intentions but the craftsmanship is questionable. Rusted areas under the paint, holes don't align well and some parts of the bars are bent out of place. I don't care about aesthetics honestly but the bar wobbles with every rep because of one portion being drastically different in level than the other. Requested a replacement but was told I had to dismantle it and bring it to the store myself.
customer_reviews.author: Shon A.

customer_reviews.title: These work for me.
customer_reviews.text: These work fine. No need to spend extra $100 on similar ones. The only problem is that when you line them up side by side, they're not of equal lengths. Does not affect the use of them though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better quality than lebert equalizer asst half the price
customer_reviews.text: These bars are much better quality, in being more stable and having a better grip system than the lebert plus the unique addition if the bar to connect them makes them even more superior for doing riskier exercises. Plus look at the much better pricing!
customer_reviews.author: jon doe

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Bar length and misplaced grip attachment
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled the bar differed in length and grip placement. This statement proved true when safety connector was attached.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Very sturdy. Just wish it was height adjustable. Gets the job done but it's slightly uncomfortable for me being 6ft tall. Probably perfect for someone 5'10 and under
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Castro

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend it to anyone. It was really easy to put together and I have never put anything together lol! It also holds my weight pretty good and I love the safety connection.
customer_reviews.author: Kadie Evans

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, also very sturdy. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tuzz11

customer_reviews.title: 😍💪🤙
customer_reviews.text: It takes at least two people to put it together 💪😍😇
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Screw problem
customer_reviews.text: One of the screws would not go in since it was not properly fitted. I called customer service several times and they did not respond.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe E.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to home workout setup. Easy to assemble & the price was not bad.
customer_reviews.author: J west coast

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and functional for less than competitors
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this product and the extra optional stability of the middle bar. Easily assembled although the tool they give you is a bit lame.
customer_reviews.author: Bobi Jo

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: they work well my wife loves them that hold my weight and hers. They are sturdy and easy to put together, just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: No need to spend $$$ for the competition. These are solid, easy to assemble and have identical dimensions to the higher-priced alternatives. Plus you have the option of linking them for greater stability.
customer_reviews.author: DF Tahoe

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: you have to have the connector for it to be truly level
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: Got it used for $40. Sturdy and stable thanks to the additional connector. This dip station is a perfect addition to my workout routines!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Place

customer_reviews.title: Good and strong steal
customer_reviews.text: Easy mount and dismount. Strong steal. Nice hight. Using almost every. My girlfriend exiting and very love this. Thanks for great price and good product
customer_reviews.author: Artem Sierhieienko

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to buy at first because people kept saying it was cheap. It's very strong and reliable
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: surprisingly stable, but they are a little low to the ground for tricep dips
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great workout gear for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my needs. I'm 6'2 and it would be nice if it were a bit taller, but overall works great for doing bicep dips. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Morio

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: At the moment I'm mainly using this for inverted rows, which it does rather well. Very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: Great! Works for the price use it for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great ! Works for the price use it for my clients and Bootcamp and it very stable and strong
customer_reviews.author: dubawalt

customer_reviews.title: It was as expected. It did had the dimensions ...
customer_reviews.text: It was as expected. It did had the dimensions but in my opinion it is very short. Quality is ok
customer_reviews.author: georgios kirykos

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, even without connector.
customer_reviews.text: a bit short for a 6 ft tall person BUT it does force perfect form!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Roman

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: I returned this.... it was way too bulky and you can only do so much on it.. I rather just use my pull up bar I can put on the door.
customer_reviews.author: Jackelin P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my sons use these indoors and outdoors to practice parallel bars skills.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and safe to use
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy and safe to use. I absolutely love this product and not to mentioned the price is fantastic. I got them within 3 days. Super please with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: not level. the bars rock from side to side ...
customer_reviews.text: not level. the bars rock from side to side when placed on the floor. still functional but very annoying
customer_reviews.author: C. dennis

customer_reviews.title: Go for the more durable options
customer_reviews.text: These bar hurt your hands. They aren’t cushioned enough and feel wobbly
customer_reviews.author: YVONNE

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the same product and color in the picture but still working good
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The tool dont fit the screws make no sense other than that great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lost functionality due to poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Misaligned holes. Can't use the connector of dip bars.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Though it would be nice it were a bit higher but I knew what ...
customer_reviews.text: As described. No negative issues with it. Though it would be nice it were a bit higher but I knew what I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: It works however I am 5'9 and when I go down my feet almost touch the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Beni Navarro

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: screw holes are misaligned. cant even assemble with the proper amount of screws. wobbly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Dip Bars
customer_reviews.text: Could use more padding on the foam grips but overall a sturdy product. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth all the trouble
customer_reviews.text: Trying to get a replacement part for this thing due to a manufacturing defect is incredibly time-consuming and difficult. I sent them a detailed description of the problem. They asked for a picture. I sent them a picture. The picture wasn't good enough and they asked me what part it is. They asked for another picture. This whole ordeal is taking far too long. I have worked in customer service for a decade and find this to be really unreasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Dicksalad

customer_reviews.title: Wanna say great dip station
customer_reviews.text: Wanna say great dip station.im 206lbs 5'9". Use it 3 times a week. An great buy. Not wobbly easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: ERNEST GREGORY

customer_reviews.title: but if you’re tall I’d strongly recommend not buying these and getting something with 48” bars ...
customer_reviews.text: These are okay, but if you’re tall I’d strongly recommend not buying these and getting something with 48” bars or higher. I’m 6’4 and my knees hit the ground when I dip low. You can use these for rows but I’d recommend rings. Ultimately, I think there are better options for a similar price.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend if you are any taller than me
customer_reviews.text: At 6'1" I am nearly too tall for this. I would not recommend if you are any taller than me. Otherwise the product is very stable and strong. If you find the product to be unstable, grab a wrench and tighten down the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: BizzyB

customer_reviews.title: a bit too low for usage. have a weird ...
customer_reviews.text: a bit too low for usage. have a weird smell on the grip. I weight around 140 lbs and could see it bend slightly when using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item...worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love these bars....very strong and versatile.....great for press ups if you have sore wrists...very stable which was my biggest concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to have purchased these. Very well made, hard to believe the price based on quality and design. The design is better than the Libert bars as you can separate the two bars or join them for more stability. I am 195 pounds and they are very very stable on all the stuff I do on them. I use them all the time and they are fun to use and very effective. I do dips, push ups reverse pull ups and reverse chin ups and other basic stuff. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Rotten

customer_reviews.title: Man Strength Jungle Gym
customer_reviews.text: Excellent parallettes. Im 6'3 and can easily do dips on these. I mainly do hanging leg raises and hand stand kick ups. VERY STURDY. @ 190 lbs I feel solid on these.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction but uneven
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction but uneven. Not good as a stand alone(base to narrow and unstable) need to be connected together.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Nunez CFT

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality but strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality but strong and durable. The first one I received was missing all of the hardware needed to put it together. Thankfully Amazon has amazing customer service so they replaced it for free and paid for the postage to send the first one back (Amazon 5/5). The second one I received had all the parts but one of them was missing a bolt hole. It still went together just fine though thankfully. Also the first time I used it half of the logo came off of the grip. So the quality isn't so great, but it's definitely build pretty strong and it is priced much cheaper than the others so you can't expect too much.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to see this was half the price of the other brand so I happily purchased it. When I went to assemble it however, whoever made this product didn't make the screw holes big enough to twist the dang screws in. I tried every single screw in practically every hole it needed to go in, and only a few worked. Couldn't believe it.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Williams

customer_reviews.title: works realllllly well i love it but its kinda uneven in the way that ...
customer_reviews.text: works realllllly well i love it but its kinda uneven in the way that it isnt parallel, but it is the same hight if you get what im saying... but it isnt that big of a deal
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: The foam grips are not thick so my hands hurt really bad and will probably need to wear gloves to perform ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and I'm no impressed with it. The foam grips are not thick so my hands hurt really bad and will probably need to wear gloves to perform any type of workout. The bars are not as sturdy as I thought it would be. Will I get much use from it. Probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Migliacci

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The bolts don't fit quite right, still very wobbly despite the connector. 2 bolts are stripped and one won't tighten. Keeping it because I couldn't find one cheeper.
customer_reviews.author: SDmom

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness SF-BH6507 Dip Station Body Press Parallel Bar with Adjustable Length and Foam Grips
product_meta.description: Target your upper body as you dip deep with the Dip Station with Safety Connector by Sunny Health and Fitness! The heavy duty steel frame supports rigorous workouts. Build endurance as your grasp the soft foam hand grips for full comfort and support during all of your dip routines. The Sunny Dip Station helps you engage and strengthen muscles in your chest, biceps, triceps, lats, oblique, forearms, wrists, lower back, and abs. The safety connector feature allows you to increase the intensity of your workout and repetitions while maintaining stability and form. Made of a lightweight heavy-duty steel frame, this station is easily transportable and compact for any in home gym.
feature_bullets: SOLID STEEL FRAME: Durable steel frame makes this dip trainer excellent for your home gym. Get the confidence to increase the intensity of your workout with the dip bar fitness station that will support you.

SAFETY CONNECTOR: Unlike traditional dip stations, the Sunny fitness dip exercise equipment is connected through the adjustable safety connector. This will allow you to contract and extend the bar to your liking from 20” to 28”.
FOAM HAND GRIPS: Soft foam grip handles are designed for comfort during your exercise. Non-slip handles allow you to perform your dips and pushups without experiencing hand fatigue.
FULL BODY WORKOUT: The dip bar fitness station will help you sculpt arms, chests and shoulder muscles.

COMPACT DESIGN: Measuring at 46L x 26W x 30H the dip station works as a compact personal fitness trainer for any home gym. The low impact, strength training workout exerciser is very easy to assemble.
